title: Did Linkin Park matter in the end? - Quora

response.answer_text: To me, not necessarily. Granted my exposure to nu metal was very short, but they did nothing for me. I did find it cheap that they had their huge moment with “Hybrid Theory”, rode that out for at least four years and released nothing but a fucking remix of that same album and nothing new, so calling them a “one hit wonder” isn't 100% incorrect. The likes of KoRn, Slipknot, and even freaking Limp Bizkit had more of a lasting impact in the end. Much like Disturbed, they had their moment and faded away.

I’d say so. They made a big impact on me, and lots of other people. Their lyrics really spoke to so many different people in so many different ways. They also had a special sound. They mixed rapping and screaming, which was done before, but was still pretty uncommon. While they may have not been super metal, they were definitely a gateway band. Kids would listen to LP and then end up to some underground thrash metal band that not many people have heard of later in life.

Come on you know this is what you wanted. I tried so hard and got so far But in the end, it doesn't even matter I had to fall to lose it all But in the end, it doesn't even matter It looks it doesn't even matter in the end a song by Linkin park!
